unnormalised: New Delhi: The Ministry of Education has announced a mandatory integration of the APAAR ID (Automated Permanent Academic Account Registry ID) for all students from pre-primary to higher education levels across the nation. This initiative, aimed at streamlining academic records and enhancing transparency, will require all educational institutions to register their students with unique APAAR IDs before the academic year 2025-26, starting 01/04/2025.
normalised: New Delhi: The Ministry of Education has announced a mandatory integration of the A-P-A-A-R I-D (Automated Permanent Academic Account Registry I-D) for all students from pre-primary to higher education levels across the nation. This initiative, aimed at streamlining academic records and enhancing transparency, will require all educational institutions to register their students with unique A-P-A-A-R I-Ds before the academic year two thousand twenty five to twenty six, starting first april two thousand twenty five.

unnormalised: The APAAR ID, a 12-digit unique identifier, will serve as a lifetime academic identity for each student, allowing them to access and manage their academic achievements, certificates, and credits in a secure digital format. The move comes as part of the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, which emphasizes the creation of a digital ecosystem for education. The system will also be linked to the Academic Bank of Credits (ABC), enabling students to accumulate and transfer credits across different institutions.

The system will also be linked to the Academic Bank of Credits (A-B-C), enabling students to accumulate and transfer credits across different institutions.

unnormalised: According to the official notification released on 15/11/2024, all schools, colleges, and universities, whether government-funded or private, must comply with the new directive. The registration process will involve collecting student details such as name, date of birth, Aadhaar number (optional), and other relevant information. Institutions are required to ensure the data privacy and security of student information, adhering to the established guidelines.

unnormalised: Dr. Anita Sharma, Secretary of Higher Education, stated, "The APAAR ID will revolutionize the way academic records are managed in India. It will reduce paperwork, eliminate duplication, and provide students with a single platform to access all their academic information. This is a significant step towards creating a more efficient and student-centric education system." The ministry has also launched a helpline number, 1800-11-2222, to assist institutions and students with the registration process.

unnormalised: In a related development, the Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship has announced that the Skill India Digital platform will also integrate the APAAR ID to link individuals' academic qualifications with their skill certifications. This integration will enable employers to verify candidates' skills and qualifications more efficiently, improving employment prospects. NSQF (National Skills Qualification Framework) levels will also be integrated for seamless matching.

unnormalised: Furthermore, the UIDAI (Unique Identification Authority of India) has clarified that providing Aadhaar is optional for APAAR ID generation. Alternate identification documents will be accepted to ensure that no student is excluded from the system. However, linking Aadhaar will streamline the verification process and provide added security, as stated in circular no. 234/2024.

unnormalised: The initiative has garnered mixed reactions from stakeholders. While many educators and students have welcomed the move as a progressive step towards digital transformation, concerns have been raised about data security and the potential for exclusion of students without access to technology. The ministry has assured that measures are being taken to address these concerns and ensure the smooth implementation of the APAAR ID system across the country. The portal apaar.gov.in is now live for registration and information dissemination.
